questions.text: What is the primary purpose of the Access to Housing policy?

options.A: To prioritize units for clients with the highest income
options.B: To ensure equitable access to housing options that fit client needs and preferences
options.C: To require abstinence before housing placement
options.D: To centralize all housing decisions with program staff

questions.explanation: The policy exists to ensure equitable access to a range of options that match client needs and preferences.

questions.text: Which statement best reflects a harm reduction approach in housing?

options.A: Housing is contingent on full sobriety and treatment completion
options.B: Clients are discharged for any missed appointment
options.C: Support aims to reduce negative consequences without imposing unnecessary conditions
options.D: All clients must meet strict compliance milestones before move-in

questions.explanation: Harm reduction focuses on minimizing negative consequences rather than requiring abstinence or strict compliance.

questions.text: Low-barrier housing is best described as housing that:

options.A: Screens out applicants with any credit issues
options.C: Requires a co-signer for all applicants
options.D: Limits access to people with no criminal history

questions.explanation: Low-barrier housing reduces entry requirements to increase accessibility for people with complex needs.

questions.text: Equitable access in this policy means:

options.A: First-come, first-served access regardless of needs
options.B: Equal opportunity to secure suitable housing regardless of background
options.C: Prioritizing clients with perfect rental histories
options.D: Reserving units for program graduates only

questions.explanation: Equitable access ensures all clients have fair opportunities, regardless of circumstances.

questions.text: What is the primary use of the Affordable Housing & Shelter Locator?

options.B: To identify properties with lowered barriers and review availability

questions.explanation: Staff use the locator to view properties with negotiated screening criteria and check availability.

questions.text: Respecting client choice in housing means:

options.A: Staff select the closest available unit to the office
options.B: Clients choose among options even if staff would choose differently
options.C: Clients must accept the first unit offered
options.D: Choices can be limited when the market is tight

questions.explanation: The policy emphasizes client choice without imposing limitations based on market conditions or staff preferences.

questions.text: Which of the following is a screening barrier that staff may negotiate with landlords?
questions.explanation: The policy lists income-to-rent ratios among negotiable screening barriers, alongside credit, criminal history, evictions, and debt.

questions.text: Which is an example of a risk mitigation strategy to support landlord engagement?

options.B: Offering additional deposits or first and last month's rent
options.C: Guaranteeing immediate eviction for any lease violation
options.D: Requiring a co-signer for all clients

questions.explanation: The policy encourages using program funds for additional deposits or first and last month's rent to mitigate landlord risk.

questions.text: Why does the policy reference PSH fidelity?

options.A: To limit eligibility based on diagnosis
options.B: To align practices with high standards in housing provision
options.C: To require sobriety for all placements

questions.explanation: Referencing PSH fidelity signals adherence to high standards consistent with permanent supportive housing principles.

questions.text: Which task is appropriate when assisting a client with housing applications?

options.A: Completing the application without client input
options.B: Visiting units with the client and supporting their application
options.C: Selecting a unit and informing the client post-lease

questions.explanation: Staff should visit potential units with clients and assist with application steps while honoring client choice.

questions.text: In a tight rental market, how should staff apply the low-barrier principle?

options.A: By limiting the client's options to expedite placement
options.B: By maintaining client choice and avoiding unnecessary conditions
options.C: By requiring a higher credit score cutoff
options.D: By refusing to negotiate screening criteria

questions.explanation: The policy states staff should respect client choices and avoid imposing limitations based on market conditions.

questions.text: Which item is LEAST likely to be a negotiable screening barrier?
questions.explanation: Fire safety regulations are not screening criteria and cannot be negotiated; the policy focuses on credit, criminal, eviction, and debt-related barriers.
